name: David Letterman
monologue: Scientists have been looking at the Mona Lisa painting and they found that it has 30 layers of paint. The only other person I know like that is Betty White.

name: David Letterman
monologue: Top Ten Signs You're Obsessed With Facebook

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: If Tropical Storm Bonnie turns into a hurricane, it can turn the Gulf of Mexico into a giant salad spritzer — and we are the salad.

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: A huge oil spill, a sneaky oil company, and a hurricane — I don’t like it. There are too many villains, it’s like “Spiderman 3.”

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: You can be proud to be a nerd at Comic-Con. When I was a young nerd, we knew our place — in our parents’ basement eating Bugles and playing Risk.

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: Facebook now has 500 million users. The previous record holder was heroin.

name: Jay Leno
monologue: Former Illinois Gov. Rod Blagojevich did not testify at his trial. He wanted to testify, but he sold his seat at the court for $100,000.

name: Jay Leno
monologue: Happy birthday to former Sen. Bob Dole. He’s 175 years old today.

name: Jay Leno
monologue: Have you guys seen this show “White House Apprentice?” It’s a lot like the other “Apprentice,” but on this one, when the boss fires you, he offers you your job back a day later.

name: Jay Leno
monologue: Britney Spears has been giving her support to Mel Gibson throughout the scandal, which is ironic because Mel’s latest tape is called, “Oops, I did it again.”

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: President Obama and his family are going on vacation in the Gulf Coast next month. Of course, the Gulf Coast is a lovely place to sit back and relax — just ask BP.

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: Starbucks’ profits went up 37 percent in the third quarter of this year. They say they owe the increase to their new strategy of opening a Starbucks inside an existing Starbucks.

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: Parents in Georgia want a middle school to ban T-ball after a 14-year-old boy hurt his shoulder in gym class. In a statement, the parents said, “School should be a place where kids can learn and safely grow up into wussies.”

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: Yesterday in France, there were no injuries when a passenger train hit a truck full of shampoo. However, some of the passengers are believed to be in critical conditioner.

name: Craig Ferguson
monologue: Comic-Con starts today. It’s a four-day celebration of science fiction and comics. Every year, an army of geeks descends on San Diego.

name: Craig Ferguson
monologue: If you live anywhere other than San Diego and you need a computer fixed, you’re screwed.

name: Craig Ferguson
monologue: Right now, jocks are wandering around San Diego wondering, “Who should I give a wedgie to?”

name: Craig Ferguson
monologue: They’re expecting 120,000 people and three of these people will be female.
